website_summaries.verdict: Despite some longevity concerns, these versatile bags are made of material that makes them practical to be used in ways not possible with competitors. Comes in size and design options to fit almost any customer's needs.
pros: Stand out from the pack for being made of silicone, which is BPA-free, reasonably durable in most conditions, and practical to use in many ways – in the microwave, freezer, and dishwasher
Available in numerous styles, sizes, colors, and graphic
cons: Holes and torn seams may occur with repeated use
Press-lock seals take a bit of effort to close completely
Reports of mold forming when seams/corners didn't dry thoroughly

customer_reviews.title: Useless
customer_reviews.text: Just got my order of Stashers. What a disappointment. You cannot use them for sandwiches. I read the caveats about the size precluding Italian rolls, large sandwiches...mine was a simple turkey sandwich. Could not get it in the bag, and if I had, it would have come apart and been a mess. And it would never have come out in one piece. So. I don't know how the New York Times Wirecutter came up with its recommendation, but this is a completely useless product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bags Riped
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these bags, one storage size specifically used to cook steak using a Sous Vide and the sandwich size for my Toddlers muffin/snacks. Both bags were purchased about the same time, always hand washed and handled with care. Unfortunately they both riped, in different places within the same week...as in they are resuable until they are not and at the price I paid for bag not worth it. Dont waste you money.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Greisen

customer_reviews.title: Looks Can Be Deceiving
customer_reviews.text: This is a great looking silicone bag...online. In reality upon receiving it we were surprised that it was really thin and at the edges of the top the silicone it started to rip upon inspection. Also, after closing the bag up and barely touching it to check the air tightness, it popped open like a balloon with ease. We were very disappointed and I would not recommend it to anyone, even if it looks great...online.
customer_reviews.author: Alex G.

customer_reviews.title: Works well but does not last
customer_reviews.text: I was given one of these bags as a gift and used it for several months with my sous vide--but the bag ripped down the side (starting at the seam). I figured I had somehow cut it with a knife, perhaps while cleaning, and so ordered another set. I've only had these bags short while--about six weeks--and last night noticed that one of the bags has already ripped, again at the seam, and so is unusable. Too bad--it's a great product if only it lasted.
customer_reviews.author: Dallas Clemmons

customer_reviews.title: RIPPED.
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: sandwich size ripped down the entire side. i was them inside out (so i can get the inside clean) and while i was flipping it, it completely ripped down the side. i was using no force at all, i assumed it just got weak after a few washes. SUPER disappointed, probably won’t be purchasing anymore. UODATE:^ original review: I loved my sandwich size so much that I went out and got another, plus two snack size and the larger one (half gallon I think?). so grateful I was able to stop buying ziplocks and make a more eco friendly choice.
customer_reviews.author: Kiley Crump

customer_reviews.title: Amazing idea! Keep my frozen bananas in them when ...
customer_reviews.text: Amazing idea! Keep my frozen bananas in them when they start to go bad. The freezer disposable bags used to freezer-burn them. These reusuable bags keep these from getting freezer burned and they taste amazing in my smoothies. Easy to close too! I need 100 more! I love this color, however I think I would lean towards clear since if I have multiple in the freezer, it's easier to see what's in them.
customer_reviews.author: Sasha

customer_reviews.title: so disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: Went to use it and there was a hole in one of The corners. Was still going to use it for travel but couldn't get over the very offensive odor despite multiple washes. Big thumbs down, so disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: Hole in seam in one month
customer_reviews.text: We used this bag on average twice a week for Sous Vide. On the last use the side seam ruptured after only using it one month.
customer_reviews.author: SBH

customer_reviews.title: 1 of 2 arrived damaged from Amazon Warehouse
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two of these from the Amazon Warehouse. Both were supposed to be blue and in like new condition. One was great and as described and the other was clearly used and washed because there were water stains. Upon closer inspection, I discovered there was a hole in the top corner so I returned it. The other one has been holding up well and is easy to clean and close, although the opening seems narrow. I hand wash and put it around a cup to dry.
customer_reviews.author: DurangoMtnMom

customer_reviews.title: Too small
customer_reviews.text: We got the sandwich size, which should be big enough for, oh, a sandwich. If you hold the bread against the bag, it appears it will fit. However, the actual mouth of the bag doesn't open far enough to actually permit the bread (or a sandwich) to be inserted.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Leeches dye
customer_reviews.text: This food bag leeched orange dye over everything in the dishwasher, despite using the top rack. I have used several silicone products over the years and this is the first time I have ever encountered such a mess. I would be cautious if purchasing this item.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: After doing some research, I decided to buy Stash silicon bags. I wanted to make the transition to a more environmentally friendly lifestyle and love the idea of reusable bags. The sticker price initially scared me and I did look into alternative bags. However, what sold me on these bags is that the sides do not stick together. Many other silicon bags are made in a way that you have to pry the bags apart. I also love that it is dishwasher friendly. I now own two sandwich bags and one gallon. It has only been a week, but I am very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Pricey but worth it
customer_reviews.text: I put half an avocado in this and 3 days later it's not even brown. If I put it in a regular plastic baggie they turn brown within a day.
customer_reviews.author: Kellymn

customer_reviews.title: Great concept, product does not deliver as promised
customer_reviews.text: I loved the idea of a reusable sealable bag for snacks. However after a handful of uses I noticed a hole in one of the upper corners. I do not know how this happened but I am guessing that it happened during the cleaning process. These bags are difficult to clean because they do not easily stay open for washing or drying and even though they are supposed to be safe in the dishwasher, I am suspicious that this is what damaged the bag. I am disappointed that this product was not a better value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: L

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: These are great bags, somewhat expensive but I won't be polluting the landfills. They wash up great in the dishwasher. I'd like to get a few more.
customer_reviews.author: Peggy

customer_reviews.title: Food tastes like plastic
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to replace my Ziplock bags with these but I was really disappointed. Although they are durable, leakproof, and easy to clean, they make the food inside taste like plastic (regardless of how long the food stays inside). It’s so pronounced that my 2 year old notices it and won’t have her snacks from them. I’ve tried dishwasher cleaning, hand washing, different soaps, etc. and the result has been the same. I’m pretty disappointed because it’s a great idea in theory.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not happy with
customer_reviews.text: I cannot get a sandwich to fit through the zip part/opening. Not happy with product
customer_reviews.author: Ivan T. Stolte

customer_reviews.title: Best Investment
customer_reviews.text: I love my stasher bags they are truly great. I have couple in each size, I was so glad to see when they released the half gallon. I wash them by hand and air dry them upside down, I've never had any issues with mold or anything.
customer_reviews.author: Oliva Toro

customer_reviews.title: Thick and strong bag that seals very well, but a bit hard to open.
customer_reviews.text: Great quality and seals very well; however, there are two difficulties that knock off a star: 1) The thick silicon bag (good) makes it a little hard to squish out air for sous vide and to clean thoroughly afterward, and 2) very easy to seal, but (for me) very hard to open! So, once it is "burped," great for sous vide, but a little hard to open up if you need to do it multiple time to get the air out. However, for the job of sealing and protecting with a safe and THICK silicon bag, this definitely does the trick.
customer_reviews.author: D. N. Knisely

customer_reviews.title: Seam separated - poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Used this only a couple of times (in freezer only) and the side seam has separated!! See top right corner in pic. I will not buy this product again. Other silicon storage bags I purchased at the same time have not had a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Heavy, Thick, Reusable, but not for Liquids
customer_reviews.text: This review is for a 15-ounce version of the Stasher bag. The bag is made of 100% silicone, and is very thick and heavy. It's design means it doesn't hold as much volume as I'd expect it to. Once washed, you'll need to place it inverted over something so that it can air dry. I tried filling it with water, sealing it, then placing pressure on the bag. The seal quickly gave way, and water gushed out all over the sink and back splash. So, while this bag works ok for solids, I would not recommend using it for liquids. Ever. I'm not at all thrilled with this bag, but my wife likes it so far.
customer_reviews.author: Hawaii

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: The concept is great. The eco-freindly aspect is great. Its the perfect size. The product needs tweaking. I bought this in hopes of carrying nuts or other small snack items in my bag. Unfortunately, due to its molded pouch shape, it pops open on its own with minimal pressure applied to the sides. Even when I burped it, it opened on its own if something knocked against it in my bag. Luckily, the first time this happened it did not contain a liquid or it would have caused a mess. I gave this Stasher several attempts to give me reason to keep using it but am going to return it. So sad. I really wanted this to work.
customer_reviews.author: Bryce

customer_reviews.title: LOVE Stasher bags
customer_reviews.text: LOVE Stasher bags. The bigger half-gallon size is great for freezer storage, especially smoothie ingredients and for freezing meat. I can thaw fish and shrimp and chicken and whatever other kind of meat I portion out in these directly in the bag without having to deal with frozen-on butcher paper from the grocery store. Great for when you buy several pounds of meat or fish or poultry when it's on sale and want to freeze in portions.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki

customer_reviews.title: Too small for a sandwich
customer_reviews.text: The silicone opening is pretty small, and so it's very difficult to fit even a small sandwich in the bag. It's also not the easiest to clean. I guess I'll use it for grapes? I definitely wouldn't purchase it again,.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Filmy residue - impossible to rinse away.
customer_reviews.text: After washing, I can not removed the filmy residue. They look dirty and unappetizing. They feel dirty. Nice idea with poor thought-out execution.
customer_reviews.author: R + K

customer_reviews.title: It's not sandwich size
customer_reviews.text: Not sure what kind of sandwiches these folks eat, but they're certainly nothing like mine. Typically, mine are bread (store sliced), a couple slices of meat, a slice of cheese and about a 1/2" layer of lettuce. And with that, you can barely squeeze it in this bag - even after cutting in half. As much as anything, it doesn't expand enough to accommodate. I guess if you're strictly a PB&J fan, this will do fine. Anything else, not so much.
customer_reviews.author: M. Richard

customer_reviews.title: Hard to clean
customer_reviews.text: These are tricky to wash and dry. If you don’t thoroughly dry, it will make whatever you put into it soggy quickly. They also always have water spots on them or a chalky film left but the dishwasher.
customer_reviews.author: Brandi Donn

customer_reviews.title: not good for storing cheese
customer_reviews.text: I had bought these to replace the Ziploc bags we use when storing chunks of leftover cheese (e.g. cheddar). The cheese dries out very quickly in these bags which surprises me as I thought they were supposed to be air tight. I tried it several times to make sure it wasn't user error on my part (e.g. failing to seal the bag). The cheese dried out every time.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine C.

customer_reviews.title: Don’t flip inside out to wash
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love this stasher so badly - and I did... until I turned it inside out to wash the inside and it split and ripped right down the steam, making it completely unusable. Heartbroken and missed the return window. I tried a knock off version “convenience on the go” and got a whole pack for the same price as this one stasher and it washes great! Save your money and go the knock off route.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Plahanski

customer_reviews.title: WTF, ONLY ONE BAG FOR $15.00!
customer_reviews.text: I should have paid closer attention. One bag for this outrageous price! It's my fault I should have read the reviews and checked to see how many bags. And I couldn't imagine getting only one bag for this exorbitant price. Just think of all the Ziplock bags one can get for 15 bucks, plus; you don't have to wash them. Lesson learned!
customer_reviews.author: John Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy them
customer_reviews.text: Like many people, I thought these would replace my use of disposable, sealable plastic bags. Also, like most people... I've discovered that they are impossible to clean... and they do NOT hold a seal, they will open under modest pressure (applied to the sides. These are an interesting attempt to replace "baggies", but you really should wait until Design V2.0 to resolve the cleaning and seal-keeping issues.
customer_reviews.author: Marc

customer_reviews.title: Not durable at all
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this product! Read so many great reviews so I figured I would purchase. After only one use the bag is no longer of use. Has a tear right at the top under the zip enclosure. All I ever put in it was a small sandwich. Washed it it the dishwasher on the top rack and then when I went to use it the next time I saw there was a slit in the bag. I was never hard on it or anything! Have no idea why it would tear like that already. I thought it would be more durable than a plastic baggie! So disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Stella

customer_reviews.title: Strange taste imparted to food
customer_reviews.text: I loved these at first, but then every time I try to use them- the food tastes weird. I put grapes inside and then the grapes tasted odd. They also seem to retain the small of soap and that might be part of the funky flavor issue.
customer_reviews.author: Destiny Bell

customer_reviews.title: Great concept, terrible execution
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited when received these and so disappointed at the durability. Leak proof? Yes, I trasported shampoo from Hawaii to Texas in one of these and the bottle top came off, all the liquid spilled into bag and not a drop out of the bag. However, the bag warped after one use in the microwave. I had another warp when I washed it in warm water. I also got a snack bag and the cookies I stored in it tasted like plastic. I threw the others I got away.
customer_reviews.author: DD

customer_reviews.title: Not my favorite reusable bags
customer_reviews.text: These are ok if you have a very small amount of stuff to take with you. They have a very narrow opening so are not that easy to fill or clean. they don't stay open on their own so you have to have 3 hands to fill without making a mess if you are filling with liquid or anything with a sauce. Also, they are very small in width so you can't put much in them. Maybe good for babies snacks, but for an adult they just don't hold much. I bought another brand that stands up on its own and has large openings and now never use these. Look for those instead.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth M

customer_reviews.title: Such a brilliant product!
customer_reviews.text: I love that these are cute, dishwasher safe and going to help the planet-not in that order! So easy to use and clean, they are going to replace any plastic bags going forward for packed lunches.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 60 days
customer_reviews.text: We used it a few times over 60 days. Nothing heavy. I had some small wrapped candies in it most the time. Cleaned it and was opening it to dry it and suddenly it ripped at the top corner. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: B. Bird

customer_reviews.title: WHAT?!?!?
customer_reviews.text: Well, these are amazing. I didn't expect them to be. I'm trying to replace disposable items in my home with more sustainable/eco-responsible items. I ordered these just to try. I did not expect to love them as much as I do. They are thick and sturdy. The top is easy to close and it stays closed. Cleaning is a breeze because the opening is big enough to get your scrubber in there and really get it clean. A+++
customer_reviews.author: Grasshopper

customer_reviews.title: Not air tight.
customer_reviews.text: This is such a great idea I bought a set as a Christmas gift. Unfortunately the recipient has let me know one is not air tight. I’m hoping the manufacturer will send me a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Laughlin

customer_reviews.title: ripped after one month
customer_reviews.text: I’m so sad about this. I was so excited about these bags and literally within a month the side of the bag tore. They are not cheap so I would not expect this. I will be returning, unfortunately.
customer_reviews.author: Mandyjean

customer_reviews.title: Half gallon is not useable for even a sandwich.
customer_reviews.text: False advertising. Unit can not hold a pint of liquid. Can not clean inside corners.
customer_reviews.author: Cosmic Eyes

customer_reviews.title: Neat!
customer_reviews.text: These are great - I've used them for everything from holding snacks and small items while backpacking to storing frozen food and leftovers. I like that you can boil these, it makes it really easy to take veggies out of the freezer and cook them right in the bag. Easy to clean in the dishwasher + a bottle brush when needed.
customer_reviews.author: Cassandra

customer_reviews.title: no good
customer_reviews.text: We tested it with water and it pops open/leaks. I would not purchase nor recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Works great except for smell
customer_reviews.text: We have really liked this but after keeping an onion in it we can’t get rid of the smell! Any ideas? We have soaked it and scrubbed it over and over! I will have to throw it away if I can’t get that strong smell out which I sad for how expensive it is.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Marr

customer_reviews.title: Seal Does Not Hold
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to get these. Just filled one, sealed it and when I went to use turn the bag over the seal did not hold. I tried again and again but it is very loose and just doesn't hold. Very disappointing. I could not even rate how easy they are to clean because I haven't gotten that far nor will I if they don't work.
customer_reviews.author: LAS

customer_reviews.title: Damaged
customer_reviews.text: Damaged after just one use in freezer :( Upset at the durability.. maybe the one I got was defective. Disappointed.... I heard really good things about this product but mine just didn’t hold up.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Calk

customer_reviews.title: Why I ordered more of a product I didn't initially like...
customer_reviews.text: So, the first time I tried to use these for storing food, I was more than annoyed...impossible to get open, tough to seal, and difficult to get an actual sandwich in. I thought this was big clunky waste of money. However, quite by accident, I discovered what these are brilliant at...freezing food! Now, my freezer is full of these holding fish, prawns, hamburger, chicken - all right from the store, in their original store packing, and stuffed into the Stashers. Freezes everything without the extra frost that usually accumulates. Food thaws without the excess water and meats/seafood retain their texture and flavors. I also successfully freeze extra pancakes, bagels and breads. Very happy with my investment in this product.
customer_reviews.author: GG

customer_reviews.title: I love this! I'd buy more of these and skip ...
customer_reviews.text: I love this! I'd buy more of these and skip the zip lock bags completely, but they are a bit cost prohibitive. Buying a whole set would be expensive. I will slowly add more to my collection. It washes out nicely, and goes in the dishwasher!
customer_reviews.author: Ellyn Jeck

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT WORK AT ALL- so disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a small air-tight container to keep medicine in, and I was excited to see these pocket-size containers. They seemed really original, and like nothing else i had seen. I saw several videos on how to "burp" the bag to remove the extra air- which was the reason i purchased these bags. I was so disappointed when the bag immediately filled with air. I guess that I am on the hunt, again, to find a product that does what it says.
customer_reviews.author: Cindi W.

customer_reviews.title: I think I have 8...?? 💕💕
customer_reviews.text: So I’ve been looking for reusable bags the use for freezing veggies, to replace buying the steamable bags at the store, as well as a storage solution for freezing and marinating raw meat, but still being able to sanitize. Other bags are not dishwasher safe, so I don’t feel they can be truly sanitized after meat use. These are great! Open it a bit and microwave for 4ish mins and perfectly steamed veggies, holds a perfect amount of chicken to marinate, about 1.5lbs. I wish they could be turned inside out to wash, but that’s the only thing I can knock down.
customer_reviews.author: ashleymarie

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Love this reusable bag! I usually chop up bananas for smoothies and put them in this bag to freeze because it really eliminates freezer burn. I plan on purchasing plenty more for future use.
customer_reviews.author: Mikaela Bradley

customer_reviews.title: Good, but the opening is small
customer_reviews.text: The opening for this silicone bag is bulky and small. It does close well and keeps things fresh, but consider buying a size larger than you think you'll need because the opening is tiny and difficult to get things in the bag. I do like that they're dishwasher safe, but they still need some help drying (even after the dry cycle, water droplets are still in the upside down bag). It does help me use fewer Ziplock bags, so overall, it's a good product that just needs the opening re-designed.
customer_reviews.author: Robin

customer_reviews.title: It's a gateway to more sustainable living
customer_reviews.text: This is the first products I have purchased like this. I've tried the lunch bags that were fabric with velcro and those were a huge pain to clean, and didn't work so well. But this! I'm obsessed now and feel like I need a bunch more so I can stop using plastic bags completely. We use plastic bags for almost everything, for freezing dog food, for keeping chopped onions or avocado halves fresh. There's a plastic bag I've been using for weeks to keep avocados fresh. But this is just so much better. The versatility is amazing. I haven't tried the oven yet but can't wait. Beware: once you buy this you will want a lot more!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth B

customer_reviews.title: Tore almost immediately
customer_reviews.text: I liked a lot about this bag: it sealed well (almost too well, until I figured out that it should be opened from the corner tabs), the size was really practical for a variety of items, and it fit easily into my freezer or another cramped space. Unfortunately, the silicone tore after only two weeks of light use - I have no idea what could have caused it; there was nothing sharper than cardboard in the vicinity. I suppose the material is just more fragile than I realized. These are an investment, and for me, it’s just not worth it if it means that I have to continuously baby them.
customer_reviews.author: L. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Weak seal
customer_reviews.text: I like that these are flat and I had high hopes for them. However, I'm disappointed by the seal on these containers. It only takes a small amount of pressure to burst the seal. I filled them with only air and squeezed and the seal burst open with little effort. I would not feel comfortable throwing one of these in a full backpack or bag.
customer_reviews.author: COmissMissy

customer_reviews.title: Single us plastic alternative.
customer_reviews.text: The opening is restricted, so even though the item looks like it will hold a sandwich, I can not get the opening to be wide enough to put the sandwich in. It works well for thinner foods though. It is easy to close, and I have not had a problem with leakage, though I have not used liquids in the containers.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality!
customer_reviews.text: I liked the no-plastic idea but the durability of the bag was terrible. I’m a work with my hands kind of guy and I don’t abuse or stress my tools. The first time I used this bag to make chocolate almond bark, it ripped when I rapped it on the smooth corner of our granite kitchen counter. $9 down the toilet.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Fred Silberman

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing Purchase
customer_reviews.text: Works well, however after 2.5 mths the corner tore. Defeats the purpose of sustainability and cost effectiveness if needing to be thrown in the garbage and replaced so soon. Disappointing purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Houston

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: So glad I moved over to reusable bags and these are just fantastic. One of the best I’ve found
customer_reviews.author: Monica

customer_reviews.title: Expensive and not very practical
customer_reviews.text: I try to do what I can to reduce my use of disposable plastic, but these are just not practical. Too expensive, too hard to clean and reuse.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: Really wanted to reduce my plastic waste with reusable bags but this one just does not seem to cut it. It's difficult to clean. I've used it twice and washed it in the top part of my dishwasher and then air dried by opening the top and placing it upside down on the corner of my drying rack (so that it will stay open). By the second time I used it, there was mold forming in the corner. Which wasn't too big of a deal but I couldn't reach the corners to clean it out. Unfortunately, not worth my money. Positive: It is does seem to seal pretty well and keeps its shape.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I'm a really big fan of my Stasher bag. ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm a really big fan of my Stasher bag. I've been using it for sous vide, but also general food storage. I run it through the dishwasher to clean it, and rinse with a little vinegar if it still has a food odor. The large size is larger than I need for most sous vide nights, so I've ordered the sandwich size bag as well.
customer_reviews.author: Meg

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This product is not easy to open and I don’t find much use for the size and shape. For the price I thought I’d get more than just one.
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: High quality reusable bags, a must have in any household
customer_reviews.text: We LOVE stasher bags! We have at least 12 of them in all sizes. The are so versatile and hold pretty much anything imaginable from leftovers, meats, cheese, vegetables, kids snacks, you name it! I love that they are dishwasher safe and can also be put in the freezer. We have reduced our usage of disposable ziploc bags by about 90% in our household with these. I will continue to buy stasher bags because we never seem to have enough at one time.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: Not in love. And came apart at the seam.
customer_reviews.text: I used these for the souse vide that I just bought. I used them once. They sealed nicely, but seem like they may not always seal nicely. Held up during cooking. I washed them by hand, turning them inside out to wash more thoroughly and to dry. I went to use them again today and turned them right side out. Went to put chicken in one of the bags and it came apart at the seam like it was made of butter.
customer_reviews.author: L. Sumner

customer_reviews.title: Over priced
customer_reviews.text: Over priced product which is eco friendly. Easy to clean, leak proof and durable. I returned this product as it was too pricy for just one stasher! You will need at least 10 for everyday use and buying 10 stasher for the price they charge is not economical. There are plenty of other products like this one which are reasonably priced.
customer_reviews.author: pv

customer_reviews.title: Work very well!
customer_reviews.text: These are amazing! Expensive, but they rock. Bought 4 different sizes. As im am freezing more foods during this pandemic. They seal very well and do not leak. The only thing which im sure is part of the design is the opening is smaller than the width of the bag. This allows for food to hide in the corners a bit but they a dishwasher safe which is another plus. I felt like Im helping the planet and thought I could give up plastic ziplock bags all together, but realistically I would have to buy a lot more than 4 of these and that would get very expensive. All in all, they work very well and worth the investment.
customer_reviews.author: Kay

customer_reviews.title: Want to love this but it broke real fast
customer_reviews.text: These bags are great because they are compact and fit everything in the kid lunches. BUT I bought the 15-ounce one and it already has small holes in the corners where the silicon seems thinner near the seal. This defeats the point of buying an $11+ plastic bag alternative it I have to replace this reusable plastic anyway. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: S. Ahmed

customer_reviews.title: I want more!
customer_reviews.text: I finally caved and bought a Stasher bag and I'm so happy I did. I'm now the proud owner of 3 and hopefully more in the future. These bags are great for storing all sorts of things. One thing I didn't realize until they arrived was that you can use them in the freezer, boiling in a pot of hot water, and much more! These are a little spendy if you're trying to quickly build up your supply so you can decrease your use of plastic bags but I know with just 3, I'm still helping to minimize my footprint.
customer_reviews.author: Raynelle

customer_reviews.title: Plastic smell when heated!
customer_reviews.text: There is a light plastic/chemical smell when the bag is heated in the microwave. The smell gets very strong when you put it in an oven at 350, and transfers to food. Not sure if it really is food-safe when heated.
customer_reviews.author: kun

customer_reviews.title: Honestly obsessed with this brand
customer_reviews.text: Great. Yes. Expensive? Yes. Worth it? Yes. Brought some noodles to work in this bad boy. Got home, easily rinsed out with a shake of the bag and some water, then straight into the dishwasher. Needs to be propped open with a little spoon or something to best dry, but honestly the bomb. Feels sturdy, doesn't leak (I don't gamble and take soup in a bag with it or something though) and have had several people ask me where I found it, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Casey D

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to open after freezing
customer_reviews.text: I got it in attempt to replace the disposable plastic bags I use to freeze stuff. I really want to use it more but I'm finding it difficult to open after freezing. The open is also kinda small so can't fit much things in... Now I'm struggling to find a use for it, but I'm gonna keep trying... Too bad... Just got a stand up one, works better for my using habit.
customer_reviews.author: ginboy

customer_reviews.title: I enjoy havind this with tacos
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this so much. It can be for a variety of stuff, not only food. I enjoy havind this with tacos, tamales, fruit, opened packages of cookies or candy. And this color is very pretty, the material is very durable and it's also really easy to wash.
customer_reviews.author: Karen N

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't leak and holds a lot
customer_reviews.text: I'm trying to be a better person for the environment. So that's why I bought this. I was skeptical at first because it didn't have a zip, so i wasn't sure how well it would be at holding liquids in. After fighting to get it open the first time (seriously it took like 10 minutes) i knew I wouldn't have any issues. I tried it out first with marinating some asparagus. Worked great. then a large steak. Worked even better. Will be buying more of these when I can, the price is a little steep on these. They are a bit tough to clean properly, but not impossible.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Best reusable baggie I've found
customer_reviews.text: I really hate the amount of plastic in our lives and I've tried to replace baggies with reusable versions. They've all been complete crap until these. These ones are just as easy - or easier - to seal than disposable ones. Granted, you do have to wash them, but I pop these into the dishwasher and they clean like a dream. They do tend to hang onto a bit of the water but a simple shake when I open the washer and then soon they're plenty dry. Easy to use, easy to clean, and no waste for Mother Nature. Love them. Bought more.
customer_reviews.author: Delhazan

customer_reviews.title: Nope!
customer_reviews.text: These are sold as sandwich bags. They fail in most respects when compared to disposable plastic. First they are huge and not flexible. Second they lack enough width to insert a sandwich without shredding the bread. Third they are more difficult to open than they look. Fourth this is way too much to pay for one. They may have a use, but temporary storage of sandwiches is not it.
customer_reviews.author: Jdunk2145

customer_reviews.title: Great size
customer_reviews.text: First found these bags at a big box retailer, now I'm hooked! I like the seals on these better than bags with zips. Leak proof, and perfect for snacking. When they first arrived, they were a bit static-clingy, so be sure to wash first. Drying is a tiny inconvenience, but washing is easy. So far, no leaks, no smells, and no stains. Will update review if anything changes.
customer_reviews.author: SAW

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT stay closed!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like these bags, but apparently there's a trick to keeping them closed that I'm not in on. Any kind of pressure on the bags makes them pop wide open - be it crackers, fruit, sandwiches, trail mix, etc inside. I definitely wouldn't trust them with liquids after spending so much time picking food out of my backpack! This is a huge bummer because I was so excited for these! Just wish they would actually stay closed with anything in them.
customer_reviews.author: Avid Runner and Road Biker

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE these bags
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE these bags! wow. SO easy to seal, great seal too. SO easy to wash. I bought two, I want a lot more. I use them for dragging the kids' snacks around in the car so far. We did laugh because they are "static-y" and hair will stick to them. The dog's hair from the car! But that is not a big problem. I really can use a LOT more of these. Just wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: Gramma

customer_reviews.title: Great reausbale bag perfect for snacks
customer_reviews.text: Really like this size for snacks and it’s perfect for kids. I like the reusable silicone bags rather than disposable ziplocks or sandwich bags. The seal on it is comfortable to use and tight. I got the orange and it’s a nice happy color and I love that it’s see through.
customer_reviews.author: Cin L

customer_reviews.title: Preferred Goods Storage Choice
customer_reviews.text: I like picking Stasher bags for holding small and large snacks, tea sachets and other items. You can get creative with them. They are made from durably soft machine-washable silicone. They are easy to store and come in a variety of fun colors. No complaints. I was not compensated in any fashion for this review. I like to give open, honest, transparent feedback about products I try. I hope this review has been helpful to you. If it has, please click the 'Helpful' button to let myself and others know that it has helped you.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: reusable never felt so good
customer_reviews.text: If you're thinking of going green these are great. I felt guilty using throw away sandwich bags and these area a great alternative. They are easy to clean, stay closed but are easy to open, and you can cook in them. They are worth the price! I wish they came in a larger size.
customer_reviews.author: Sophia A

customer_reviews.title: Won't zip after one wash in dishwasher
customer_reviews.text: The first time I used these I was thrilled. However, it says they are dishwasher safe, but after one wash they no longer zip, rendering them useless! Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: B. Brunner

customer_reviews.title: Unwashable mold after just a few uses
customer_reviews.text: This product is usually great, but watch out for duds. I bought 4 of these and one of them has a poorly fused corner. Water gets in during washing but can't escape. In just a few days black mold formed and grew in that corner. Obviously there is no way to remove or clean it in there. For comparison see a good one and a moldy one in the photos. For the price I expected better quality.
customer_reviews.author: Noodlelastic

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Kindergarten snack
customer_reviews.text: It's easy for him to open. He doesn't always get it closed all the way, but he's 5. Very sturdy. They say you're not supposed to turn them inside out though - that's my only complaint. If I was using these for something liquid or had something gross in them... BUT, since you can put them in the dishwasher, I just stretch them out over a few prongs so it's opened wide up and haven't had any cleaning issues. Great concept, great company, great green innovation.
customer_reviews.author: Abby A.L.B

customer_reviews.title: Mostly does what it says
customer_reviews.text: I’m slowly tried to get away from plastic bags and containers. These are expensive so this was a trial run for me. I started with cheese and pepperoni. It did not make them taste of plastic, nor did their smell impart in the plastic. I will say for longer term, a few weeks, the items were not as fresh. I love that it stand up so it doesn’t fall all over the fridge. I hand wash and air dry. The seal is awesome although I don’t know if I would use for fluids, maybe to freeze in.
customer_reviews.author: mom6789

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: We love our stashed bags! Our son has food allergies so we pack a ton of food everyday. We were going thru so many plastic bags and were feeling guilty about what we were doing to the environment and not to mention the money we were just throwing away everyday. This is well worth the money and doesn’t lose its shape like some of the cheaper versions of this do.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Kopydlowski

customer_reviews.title: ripped already
customer_reviews.text: I only got 2 months of use with this pouch before it ripped in two places. I never overstuffed it, put it in the dishwasher, or had a sharp object around it. Don't waste your money on this. Go find another environmentally-friendly alternative. I already switched over to Nordic by Nature reusable bags and they're great!
customer_reviews.author: claire coleman

customer_reviews.title: Product broke after using for two weeks
customer_reviews.text: I really liked the concept and wanted something for my son's lunch to use for sandwiches. It looked really durable, but after using for two weeks, it ripped on the side when I was putting a sandwich into it. I am completely unable to use it anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Aheart

customer_reviews.title: The sandwich size has too small an opening
customer_reviews.text: I love the concept of this product. The fact is it could have been designed better. The opening is just too small to push a sandwich through without mangling it. The opening should have been rapped around the sides. If you make this improvement, I will gladly buy another one. As it is you must cut your sandwiches into wedges in order to squeeze them through the opening. That being said, I use it every day.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: I keep buying more and more of these bags. I use them for all sorts of ways. After using it in the microwave, I can transfer it straight to my freezer. No fuss. Tip: Use a vinegar lemon solution and spray the insides to keep strong food odours at bay after washing.
customer_reviews.author: Alvaro Castro

customer_reviews.title: Don’t Buy
customer_reviews.text: This was a huge disappointment. Hair sticks to the material and the opening is too small.
customer_reviews.author: slf

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for sous vide!
customer_reviews.text: Finally! I cook via the sous vide method frequently and have been wanting a reusable bag for this purpose. This thing worked amazingly well for this. Couple of pork chops went in, used the water displacement method and it sealed up very easily- sunk too! Super easy to use for this purpose! I handwash them and dry opened and on posts to prevent mildew/mold issues. That has worked well so far, but have not tried to dry them yet on a hot steamy summer day. I highly recommend these for sous vide.
customer_reviews.author: idateacher2Top Contributor: Baking

customer_reviews.title: Great reusable snack bags
customer_reviews.text: What a great way to reduce plastic in this world. My 8 year old son reminded me that plastic takes hundreds of years to decompose. I am doing my part to help reduce the waste on this planet. One by one, we will slowly increase our reusable bags. These wash really easy, hold a perfect amount of food for kids snacks, and have yet to leak or rip.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew B.

customer_reviews.title: No leaks to report! Super easy to clean!
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to purchase these at first, but then they went on a single-day sale. Bought 4 when the price dropped and it was super worthwhile. Might have to buy a couple more at full price just because I love them so much. No leaks to report and I've used them for travel, hikes, work snacks, gym snacks, raw chicken storage, freezer storage, all kinds of things. Super easy to clean, as well! I never taste residual flavor from the last thing stored (even marinated chicken!), and they stand up on their own to drain dry. Definitely recommend these!
customer_reviews.author: Kylie

customer_reviews.title: Not big enough for a sandwich
customer_reviews.text: On first blush these seem big enough for sandwiches but the opening is considerably smaller that I expected. A sandwich made with regular sized slices of bread has to be cut to be inserted into this pouch and even then it's a tilt and twist and almost smush to get it in there. Not worth the headache when trying to get the children ready for school in the A.M. I guess this would work for snack sized things but not for sandwiches which is what I needed. This was returned.
customer_reviews.author: Lpazazz

customer_reviews.title: Best ssustainable plastic free option
customer_reviews.text: Greatest product ever! We have used ours for so many things: sandwiches, marinades, cookies, crackers, nuts. And they never stain or leave an odor. Easy to wash out and dry. They seal really well also. If you're looking for a sustainable plastic free option this is it! Can't love this product enough.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Won't totally eliminate our use of zipblocks, but a step in the right direction
customer_reviews.text: I am onstantly feeling guilty about my contribution to plastic waste. Although we aren't totally off the zipblocks yet, these are definitely helping reduce the number of plastic bags we use. I haven't had them long, but so far, so good: no tears, no odors, and the seal very well. We have to hand-wash these, so I am hoping they'll stay in shape for a while (bought 3 in total--the stand-up feature on this one is nice)
customer_reviews.author: emily

customer_reviews.title: Bag is Very Heavy
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought one of these to empty my freeze dried meals for hiking into to save space. What I didn’t realize was that they are heavier than the packaging for the meals! I decided that using 5 or 6 of these would make my backpack all that much heavier! I only bought the one, so I’m using it for my electronics since it is very waterproof. It was worth trying it out and I got a nice, completely waterproof case!
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Rips easily
customer_reviews.text: Only used this twice and found a rip in it!
customer_reviews.author: Courtney Slater

product_meta.title: Stasher 100% Silicone Reusable Bags, Pocket Storage Size, 4.5-inch (4-ounce), Set of 2, Clear + Aqua
product_meta.description: Size:Pocket| Color:Clear + AquaThis clever little Minx of a Stasher offers palm-sized convenience without even a hint of a Napoleon complex. Lightly frosted on both sides (mmm, frosting) for added discretion, the Pocket is the perfect air-tight transport for all your tiny valuables.
feature_bullets: 100% PURE NON-TOXIC PLATINUM SILICONE: The world's first fully functional, self-sealing, non-plastic bag. Plus unlike traditional plastic bags, Stasher bags contain no BPA, no PVC, and no latex. Keep your food safe from contaminants in Stasher bags!
JOIN THE PLASTIC FREE MOVEMENT: Created in response to the profound need for a healthy alternative to plastic storage.

It’s purse-lover’s companion! The Stasher Pocket is a 3D palm-sized bag that can hold up to 4 fl oz and is great for holding all of your bottom-of-the-bag essentials like bobby pins, vitamins, earbuds and lipgloss.
Lightly frosted on both sides for added discretion, the Pocket is the perfect airtight transport for all your tiny valuables.

START YOUR STASH: Half-gallon size 10.25” x 8.25” x 1.5” (64.2oz); Sandwich size 7.5” x 7.5” x 1” (15oz); Snack size 4.5” x 7.5” x 1” (9.9oz); Pocket size 3.5" x 4.5" x 1" (4oz); Stand-up size 7.75" x 7" x 3" (56oz)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars8,539 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
